GameObjects

Class PowerUp

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameObjects.GameObject
      • GameObjects.PowerUp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VisibleObject

    public class PowerUp
extends GameObject
implements VisibleObject
    the powerup class enables us to place powerups in the game some of the methods are described below

      • update

        public void update(int deltaTime,
          javax.vecmath.Vector3d playerPos)
        in this update method we determine if the powerup is gatherd by the the player and we let the sprit that is used to represent the powerup turn around.
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - used to set the length of the powerup
        playerPos - used to determine if the powerup is picked

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()

      • display

        public void display(javax.media.opengl.GL gl)
        Description copied from interface: VisibleObject
        display(GL) contains all the GL callback functions to display the object on the screen.

        The OpenGL functions can be accessed through the GL context, for example:

        • gl.glBegin( GL.GL_QUADS );
        • gl.glVertex3d( 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 );
        • gl.glEnd();
        Note that both the functions as the GL static variables are called through gl. Because the static variables should be called in a static way, we type GL in caps then, like GL.GL_QUADS.
        Specified by:
        display in interface VisibleObject
        Parameters:
        gl - the GL context in which will be drawn
